page.title: 11Admiralty Research Est.
page.content: A.R.E. Southwell is a government research establishment responsible for the application of technology to underwater warfare. Physicists and oceanographers study underwater acoustic propagation and detection. Chemists and engineers study materials for the undersea environment. Mathematicians and computer specialists use comprehensive in house facilities for, amongst other things, weapon system simulation and trials analysis. The engineering group is able to design and manufacture experimental and prototype equipment. Because of the nature of the work many of the practical aspects are carried out on ranges and at sea with the Southwell accommodation used for preparation and trials analysis.
